intro: Echites laevis, commonly known as the smooth echites, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically hairy or smooth depending on the variety. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along creeklines. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
